areaEmbed.title: Simulated Universe
areaEmbed.desc:
◆ Rules ◆
● The Simulated Universe is jointly developed by Herta, Screwllum, and Ruan Mei. It contains the following elements:
Procedurally generated enemies
Procedurally generated Aeon conscience (artificial)
Procedurally generated maze components
Procedurally generated rewards

Take caution!
● Complete the Simulated Universe to accumulate points and receive rewards. Point Rewards will be reset weekly every Monday at <unbreak>04</unbreak>:<unbreak>00</unbreak> (server time).
● Unlock Blessings and Curios in the Simulated Universe Index to receive Stellar Jades.
● Defeating an enemy in Simulated Universe's "Domain — Elite" or "Domain — Boss" will earn you extra loot.

◆ Simulated Universe: Planar Ornaments ◆
● When experiencing the Simulated Universe, Planar Ornaments can be obtained after defeating specific enemies via exchanging with Trailblaze Power or with Immersifier.
● Trailblaze Power will regenerate with time, of which 1 point is regenerated every 6 minutes. Trailblaze Power can be redeemed with Stellar Jades. When Trailblaze Power is full or has exceeded the limit, it will no longer regenerate over time.
● Immersifiers can be obtained via exchanging with Trailblaze Power or via accumulating corresponding amounts of points.
● Equip Planar Ornaments on characters to raise character's stats. When equipping a 2-piece Planar Ornament set, the special effect will be activated.

blessingEmbed.title: Blessings
blessingEmbed.desc: In Simulated Universe, Blessings can be chosen after defeating enemies, which are effective only in the current exploration.

miracleEmbed.title: Curios
miracleEmbed.desc: Curios with various effects can be encountered in the Simulated Universe. Collect Curios to Enhance your team.

192120.name: Herta's Wandering Trek
192120.lore: Madam Herta lost all interest in the space station the moment it was complete. The station maintains a steady orbital velocity as it circles The Blue, leaving a track of its circular motion on the planet below.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 3 - Immersion Device Redemption

874889.name: The Xianzhou Luofu's Ambrosial Arbor Vines
874889.lore: Once, the Luofu reigned supreme over other ships in the Xianzhou fleet due to the grace of the Ambrosial Arbor. Later, when people consumed the cursed fruit of immortality, calamity was brought upon the Luofu by the Ambrosial Arbor, whose vines had already entrapped the Luofu in its firm and inseparable grip.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 3 - Immersion Device Redemption

874890.name: The Xianzhou Luofu's Celestial Ark
874890.lore: The Xianzhou Luofu floating above the seas of stars was enclosed within the sphere. Skiffs went to and fro through the Jade Gate just like the celestial movements of stars and moons. Countless people had come here to seek the secrets of immortality, only to return in disappointment.

590362.name: Talia's Exposed Electric Wire
590362.lore: This is a wire picked up from the junkyard. With its insulation layer partially falling off and partially remaining, it was still in use. In Talia's small town of bandits, there has never been a waste that is too useless.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 4 - Immersion Device Redemption

845115.name: Vonwacq's Islandic Coast
845115.lore: On the coastline of Wacq Island, tidal waves rose and fell... This landscape remained the same for millennia and witnessed the rise and fall of civilizations just like those changing tides.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 4 - Immersion Device Redemption

790948.name: Planet Screwllum's Ring System
790948.lore: The planetary ring supports all of Planet Screwllum. Just how many are aware that the dense porous rectangular array reflects the truth about the planetary system?

790949.name: Planet Screwllum's Mechanical Sun
790949.lore: The plane encapsulates the core of Planet Screwllum, imprisoned in a cage composed of countless levers, pistons, and gears. The inhabitants of Planet Screwllum euphemistically refer to it as the "Steel Sun."
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 5 - Immersion Device Redemption

991534.name: The IPC's Trade Route
991534.lore: With the convenient help of the credit system, interstellar commerce was established. The Interastral Peace Corporation connected the stars with economic activity and expanded the borders of trade.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 5 - Immersion Device Redemption

991535.name: The IPC's Mega HQ
991535.lore: The IPC's headquarters at Pier Point is sealed within a Planar Sphere. No planet can hide from the grand business plan of the Interastral Peace Corporation. They ventured into deep space to harvest the power of the entire universe.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 5 - Immersion Device Redemption

506421.name: Salsotto's Terminator Line
506421.lore: Planet Salsotto's own rotation stopped, and thus each cycle of its day and night seemed to last forever. People can only gain the bare minimum space for survival when they ceaselessly migrated and closely chased the ever-moving terminator line.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 6 - Immersion Device Redemption

506422.name: Salsotto's Moving City
506422.lore: Enclosed within the plane is one of Salsotto's last remaining moving cities — Tumbleweed. This city never stopped and barely escaped from a fate of being swallowed up either by the dark night or the midnight sun.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 6 - Immersion Device Redemption

707007.name: Belobog's Iron Defense
707007.lore: The Silvermane Guards of Belobog stood firmly in the icy winter storm, forming a line as they wait for the incoming assault from invaders beyond the sky. The will of the Silvermane Guards was indestructible, and their line of defense would never falter.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 6 - Immersion Device Redemption

707008.name: Belobog's Fortress of Preservation
707008.lore: The Everwinter Monument, the most obvious landmark in Belobog's Administrative District, is enclosed within the plane. Those passing this monument can all feel a distant and warm gaze protecting them.
comeFrom: Simulated Universe: World 6 - Immersion Device Redemption

miracles.name: Dimension Reduction Dice
miracles.desc: When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> extra Blessing(s) can be chosen, but the number of available Blessings will be reduced by <nobr>#2[i]</nobr>. This Curio will be destroyed once this effect has been triggered <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> times.
miracles.lore: Nine six-sided dice make up this bizarre pyramidal device. It can continuously reduce the number of dimensions it occupies and exists in the 3-dimensional world as a purely 2-dimensional entity. No one knows who created it or why.

miracles.name: Chaos Trametes
miracles.desc: When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, increase the number of free Blessing resets by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>.
miracles.lore: Clouds are born from a collection of moisture. They are created without purpose and dissipate without forewarning. However, when humans gaze upon the randomly created clouds, they often project their imagination onto these shapes. The Doctors of Chaos do not believe in absolute nihility. All that appears meaningless must have its own irrefutable purpose. Chaos Trametes is their most common Curio item, used to restore the confidence of despairing Self-Annihilators and help them have a sense of purpose in their lives again.

miracles.name: Warping Compound Eye
miracles.desc: When choosing a Blessing after winning a battle, level up all 1-star Blessings that appear.
miracles.lore: There are two types of Nameless. One type enjoys the mysteries of the unknown, while the other tends to trailblaze through the universe with a plan. The latter created the Warping Compound Eyes with the power of Akivili. The light of these gadgets can warp forward to the star system ahead of the user and bring back infromation from new worlds. For the Nameless who travels alone, Warping Compound Eyes are irreplaceable tools that prevent the Nameless from plunging headfirst into worlds filled with Ambergris cheese.

miracles.name: Fruit of the Alien Tree
miracles.desc: After winning a battle, revive all downed characters in the current team and restore their HP to their Max HP. This Curio will be destroyed once this effect has been triggered <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> times.
miracles.lore: This heart-shaped fruit comes from a giant tree blessed by Yaoshi and supposedly <nobr>50</nobr> Amber Eras old. It is unclear whether the fruit would give immortality to those who eat it, but the tree itself is definitely already an immortal abomination.

miracles.name: Casket of Inaccuracy
miracles.desc: Gains <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>–<nobr>#2[i]</nobr> random Blessings after obtaining this Curio.
miracles.lore: Each side of this casket can be opened. The spaces that should be overlapping are not overlapped. Due to this unique characteristic, no one can be sure of what will happen when the box is opened. Therefore, it is not recommended to store anything in it.

miracles.name: Ambergris Cheese
miracles.desc: After winning a battle, all allies restore HP equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of their respective Max HP.
miracles.lore: Once upon a time, a helper robot turned Ambergris of Abundance into cheese on a whim to satisfy its little master's seemingly never-ending appetite. Unexpectedly, the Ambergris Cheese started to multiply on its own. The helper robot and the master worked at full speed, but their digestion still could not keep up with how fast the cheese was multiplying. Therefore, they had to ask for help from a group of passing Mourning Actors and escaped to another world on a gondola. That one world in the Galaxy is still stuffed full of delicious cheese to the day, packed so tight that not a single centimeter of space is left. The story teaches an important lesson about not wasting food.

miracles.name: Fortune Glue
miracles.desc: When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, all Blessings that appear are guaranteed to be of 3-star rarity. This Curio will be destroyed once this effect has been triggered <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> times.
miracles.lore: Is luck an ability? Maybe. Can luck be changed? Herta believes it can. That genius invented the "Fortune Glue." Just apply it on your eyelids and you would get a full <nobr>24</nobr> system hours' worth of good luck. Many at Herta space station were ecstatic to try out this invention. They all had an uneventful day, which shows that it is already lucky to be able to live an ordinary life in a turbulent world.

miracles.name: The Parchment That Always Eats
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, all enemies receive DMG equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of their respective Max HP.
miracles.lore: In Herta's Curio list, the hazard level of this parchment is marked as extremely high. It once belonged to a History Fictionologist before ending up at the space station. The parchment feeds on the history of humanity, its greedy tongue churning the collective subconscious of civilization to pieces. Herta forged false memories of the world for it to devour to satisfy its endless gluttony. But one day, this parchment will see through the genius' tricks.

miracles.name: The Doctor's Robe
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, regenerates Path Resonance Energy to max and increases Path Resonance DMG by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
miracles.lore: An incredibly expensive item surfaced on Device IX's dark web one day and grabbed the attention of countless bidders. This robe was reportedly once owned by member #64 of the Genius Society, Dr. Primitive, and supposedly had incredible powers. The seller on the dark web was anonymous. People believed them to be a member of the Galaxy Rangers and kept sending them questions. Regrettably, this mysterious owner did not make any responses even after the item was sold.

miracles.name: Society Ticket
miracles.desc: Increases the number of Cosmic Fragments received after winning a battle by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
miracles.lore: Genius Society member #56, Elias Salas, once had a beautiful dream. He wished the geniuses of the Society could come together and happily converse about their lives, loves, and dreams. For that purpose, he invented "Society Tickets" and designed an entire system that ensured every new Society member would receive this ticket even after Elias' own death. This ticket would instantly teleport the user to a specific plane decked with festive decorations. However, while every new member after #56 had indeed used their Society Ticket, not a single one of them used it at the same time as anyone else.

miracles.name: Faith Bond
miracles.desc: Reduces the Cosmic Fragments required for leveling up Blessings, resetting Blessings, and resetting downed characters by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
miracles.lore: Interastral Peace Corporation staff members who are promoted to level P<nobr>40</nobr> gain the right to purchase Faith Bonds. These bonds indicate Louis Fleming's affirmation of the individual and come with a sacred vow: The staff now has a place in the Amber Lord's destined achievement of Preservation. One person's abilities amount to nothing, their wealth also amounts to nothing, and their faith is like a single particle of dust in the wide starry seas. However, generations of humanity will join together, and ultimately obtain the power to protect the entire universe.

miracles.name: Robe of The Beauty
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, increases DMG dealt by all allies by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> for every <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Cosmic Fragment(s) you own.
miracles.lore: The entire universe bowed before the grace of the Knights of Beauty while they still traversed the skies. These noble knights who chased beauty wore resplendent gold and silver armor, and donned magnificent robes woven from silk and starlight. They had divinely beautiful features under their helmets. Even in the current era when the Beauty had already faded, those who had once witnessed the magnificence of the knights still believe Idrila will one day return.

miracles.name: Gold Coin of Discord
miracles.desc: Each time you enter the following domain, gain Cosmic Fragments equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the Cosmic Fragments currently in possession.
miracles.lore: Not all planets opened their arms and welcomed the expansion of the Interastral Peace Corporation's commercial empire. While the galactic map kept expanding, there were always rare exceptions that refused the IPC's beneficence. "Thank you," they stated, "but we don't need credits. We can look after ourselves just fine." The representative of the IPC would usually shrug at these statements, then casually destroy the root of that planet's commercial system — it was usually based on gold.

miracles.name: Void Wick Trimmer
miracles.desc: After obtaining this Curio, randomly repairs up to <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> destroyed Curio(s) and restores their remaining uses to default.
miracles.lore: Few would use this candle wick trimmer on real candles. This is usually reserved for purposes more cruel, dark, and painful. This trimmer does not cut anything material. It cuts the heat within a living organism's heart — the motivation named "passion." If the Void Wick Trimmer trims at your heart, you will feel no pain, only apathy.

miracles.name: Record from Beyond the Sky
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, all allies will nullify all DMG received except for DoT until after they are attacked, and cannot be debuffed for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s).
miracles.lore: The Beyond the Sky Choir lost their faith when Ena the Order was absorbed by Xipe. The once-solemn chords fell silent and the stars turned mute. Only a few records, made by the Choir's devoted audiences remain in this world today. When these records are placed within specific phonographs, you will hear songs from the end of the universe, sounds that contain the beauty of Order. The last Phonograph of Order was destroyed in the Emperor's War, and now the thick layer of dust on the records are protests to that soundless era.

miracles.name: Entropic Die
miracles.desc: Randomly levels up <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Blessing(s) after obtaining this Curio.
miracles.lore: Entropic Dice are common in the universe and cause countless tiny but malevolent disturbances. To use it, you grab the die tightly and think of any meaningful sentence in your head, then as you throw the die, think about the food you want to eat the most. You will receive unexpected wealth if the die lands on a certain number and wonderful love on another number, but the ends you will meet for other numbers include illness, bad luck, curses, and lifelong rain. Despite this, many people still love to play with these dice, and happily declare that these items are just a joke made by the Masked Fools.

miracles.name: Shining Trapezohedron Die
miracles.desc: Replaces all Curios currently in possession (including this Curio) with random Curios.
miracles.lore: This die has irregular sides and a wondrous light that twirls unrestrained within it. It is said to be the seal of a horrible and indescribable evil god, and one must avoid contact with it in dark places at all costs. Some people did not believe in the above myth and insisted on staying in a dark room with the die, only to find that the light within the die itself cannot be blocked out. That is how the famous Shining Trapezohedron Die Paradox came to be — You cannot prove something that cannot be proven.

miracles.name: Sealing Wax of Preservation
miracles.desc: Randomly gains 1 Blessing of Preservation after obtaining this Curio. When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, there is a greatly increased chance for Blessings of Preservation to appear.
miracles.lore: There is a saying amongst the dejected Self-Annihilators that the universe has no purpose and humans are nothing in the eyes of the Aeons. If the Aeons truly stand above all lifeforms and rule supreme, then why would they care about the everyday concerns of mortals? The existence of the sleeping and shapeless IX is proof of that. To show the Self-Annihilators that the Aeons do care, the Doctors of Chaos combined the demon god crafts of the occult monks to create the Sealing Wax of Aeons. It is said that stamping with this Sealing Wax will attract a glimpse from the corresponding Aeon from across space and time — There are no successful examples yet, but some Self-Annihilators did regain their faith in the universe, Aeons, and everything else after stamping with this sealing wax.

miracles.name: Sealing Wax of Elation
miracles.desc: Randomly gains 1 Blessing of Elation after obtaining this Curio. When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, there is a greatly increased chance for Blessings of Elation to appear.
miracles.lore: There is a saying amongst the dejected Self-Annihilators that the universe has no purpose and humans are nothing in the eyes of the Aeons. miracles.desc: Randomly gains 1 Blessing of Abundance after obtaining this Curio. When choosing your Blessings after winning a battle, there is a greatly increased chance for Blessings of Abundance to appear.

miracles.name: Corrupted Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, a character loses all their Energy when they Break enemy Weaknesses.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio regenerates characters' Energy.
miracles.lore:
There's no indentation, random line breaks, and even the names of variants and functions are incomprehensible abbreviations... It's so ugly to the point that you can't proofread it with the naked eye.

"But what if it works?"

miracles.name: Odd Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, a character loses #1[i]% of their current HP every time they use their Ultimate.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio restores HP for characters.
miracles.lore:
Your instincts tell you that the code should be okay, but they also tell you that your instincts can be wrong.

"This here looks like an infinite loop, but we can always try to run it anyways..."

miracles.name: Normal Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, allies take #2[i]% more DMG while their HP percentage is below #1[i]% of their Max HP.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio reduces DMG taken by allies.
miracles.lore:
This code might get away with its logic, but that is achieved at the expense of time and space complexity.

"It's alright. The users can't tell the difference anyways... If anyone says it's laggy, we just tell them to upgrade their RAM."

miracles.name: Elegant Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, a random enemy's action will be Advanced Forward by #1[i]% every time a character uses a Skill.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio Advances Forward characters' actions.
miracles.lore:
You'd feel delighted just by reading the code, but taking it with you still bears terrifying consequences.

"Not a single extra character... This is a piece of art."

miracles.name: Mysterious Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, enemies deal #1[i]% more DMG when another enemy unit is defeated by a character.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio increases DMG dealt by all allies.
miracles.lore:
It's a risk to run it, but writing it was a sin.

"Who wrote this? Can I charge them with deliberate assualt?"

miracles.name: Infinitely Recursive Code
miracles.desc:
Fixing this code into a normal Curio takes 3 battles.
While the code is being fixed, each time after a character uses a Skill, they consume #1[i] extra Skill Points.
Once the code is fixed, this Curio makes characters' Basic ATK recover extra Skill Points.
miracles.lore:
You are almost certain that running this code will cause stack overflow, eating up all available memory.
But doing so will give you loads of Cosmic Fragments. So why not?

"My almighty Machine Duke, I do not understand why you tolerate such heinous codes in our impeccable project!"
"Premise: Perfection is the opposite of error. Question: Is the real universe perfect? Answer: Negative. Conclusion: The Simulated Universe should not be perfect. The Simulated Universe needs errors."

miracles.name: Shattered Star Bait
miracles.desc: Increase Movement SPD by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> when in map. During combat, characters' actions are Advanced Forward by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> after they take action.
miracles.lore: Before the Dusk Wars, the exploded fragments born out of the expansion of disordered nebulas could be used as lures, and their unique aroma of galactic dust could attract Leviathans to feed on them. However, the Shattered Star Bait seems to have lost its original effectiveness after that catastrophic disaster. No matter how much scholars researched and modified the lure, no one was ever able to glimpse the form of the Leviathans again.

miracles.name: Obliteration Wick Trimmer
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, increase all allies' DMG by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for every destructible object that has been destroyed.
miracles.lore: If this candle wick trimmer is used to cut a wick, the angry anti-matter flames will ignite the candle, and the entire candlestick will be obliterated within seconds under the intense particle collisions. Exothermic reactions will be immediately triggered if this trimmer grazes your skin. Any parts of the body that the trimmer touches will instantly turn into antiprotons, reverberate throughout the body, and then scatter.

miracles.name: Insect Web
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, the character currently with the highest ATK will become Parasitized. While Parasitized, the character's ATK increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>, but will lose HP equal to <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of their current HP at the start of every turn. When this character is knocked down, Parasitized will be transferred to a random character.
miracles.lore: The Armed Archaeologists had repeatedly reported on the dangers they met in the wild. They had encountered a never-ending stretch of insect webs deep inside a nest, with the decaying shed skins of worms, tens of thousands of egg sacks, and various secretions stuck to it. Touching this web carries a high risk of becoming infected by the parasitic larvae. Once, a parasitized Armed Archaeologist steeled themselves and sliced out larvae from underneath the skin of their arm with a knife in order to deliver data to the Intelligentsia Guild for research purposes. The academic world gave this act high praises and devoted much research into it, coming to the conclusion that these creatures are very likely the descendants of Tayzzyronth, the Imperator Insectorum.

miracles.name: Angel-type I.O.U. Dispenser
miracles.desc: Cosmic Fragments are not received upon winning battles. After triggering this effect <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> times, this Curio will be destroyed and the amount of Cosmic Fragment(s) currently held will be doubled.
miracles.lore: A debt dispenser distributed by the Business Consolidation Department of the Interastral Peace Corporation. Once the outer shell is opened, it will condense into an angel-shaped counter through electron particle-wave projection. The IPC simultaneously produced many types of this item, including ones that can be worn on the wrist or in the shape of hug pillows that act as sleep aids. When using it, the client needs to periodically feed it Gold Coins, and will receive returns many times higher than the principal at the end of the debt cycle. In essence, it is an investment product.

miracles.name: Laurel Crown of Planar Shifts
miracles.desc: The current exploration will not terminate if your team is defeated in a non-boss battle. Instead, the battle will be considered as a victory, and all characters will recover HP up to their respective Max HP. After triggering this effect <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> time(s), this Curio will be destroyed.
miracles.lore: After the most intelligent minds from each galaxy are acknowledged by the Intelligentsia Guild, they could be granted the Laurel Crown of Planar Shifts at the Imperial Sentience Ceremony. The leaves of the laurel crown are made of leaves of decayed mesons, and the crown itself is woven in the shape of branches using quantum beams. After the acknowledged one puts it on, they will feel that they exist in a different plane of the universe.

miracles.name: Space-Time Prism
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, increase all ally's Eidolon Resonance level by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>.
miracles.lore: A multifaceted prism made in the shape of cheese. Every hole is an individual surface, and reflections from each prism surface produce a different effect. Some participants in experiments have their bodies physically enlarged or reduced after being reflected in the prism. Meanwhile, other participants have no bodily alterations, but instead receive memories not of their own. They become diagnosed with fictmemoria, and claim that they saw the enigmatic face of the Aeon Fuli in the prism.

miracles.name: Galactic Big Lotto
miracles.desc: After destroying destructible objects, there is a small chance of receiving 1 Curio, but also a small chance of destroying this Curio and all characters losing <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of their current HP.
miracles.lore: The marketing tactics for the Galactic Big Lotto, sold by the Interastral Peace Corporation's Marketing Development Department, is as passionate and hot-blooded as Oswaldo Schneider himself. You just need one galactic currency to bet on your luck and become a trader in the experience of making dreams, where everyone has a chance to become a galactic tycoon and join the business structure. Under Oswaldo Schneider's marketing strategy, few new worlds are able to resist such temptations — They eagerly join the Interastral Peace Corporation's universal business structure to win an entry ticket, obtaining the right to operate the Galactic Big Lotto in their own realms.

miracles.name: Omniscient Capsule
miracles.desc: Destructible objects will appear more frequently and rewards obtained from them are doubled.
miracles.lore: There is a group in the Intelligentsia Guild that believes science was originally the same as magic, that advanced science is magic and rigorous magic is science. They drew inspiration from ancient fantastic mythologies and created the Omniscient Capsule, a light-weight and convenient storage gadget. The Intelligentsia Guild planned for the Omniscient Capsule to ultimately lead to independent demiplanes, thus obtaining infinite space beyond the advanced spatial compression technologies currently in use... And they are still trying.

miracles.name: Divination Cuckoo Clock
miracles.desc: When selecting Blessings after victory, the number of available Blessings will be reduced by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>.
miracles.lore: Every day at dawn, this cuckoo clock will spit out a piece of paper with poetry written on it. All the sentences in the poems are composed of jargon from ancient mathematical systems. Some believe these poems to be prophetic and claim to be close to deciphering them, only for the clock to suddenly disappear. The possibility of foretelling the future is already priceless, and everyone is hoping for the clock to once again be circulated in the market. If that ever happened, all the riches of the universe would pour towards the clock — But there are also those who think it is only an artistic cuckoo clock designed to be good at writing poems.

miracles.name: Black Forest Cuckoo Clock
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, randomly increases the chance for <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> character(s) to be attacked by enemies for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s).
miracles.lore: After the end of the Second Machine Crisis, many robots became very anxious and were sensitive to any possible conflict. A rumor claiming that mechanical lifeforms will bring about the final disaster immediately drew the attention of all robots, and they formed an expedition team to scout unexplored lands three times. They reached the island at the southernmost tip of the land and dragged out the rumor's creator from a forest enveloped in utter darkness — A master artisan who hid in the mountains to study evil technology.

miracles.name: Perpetual Motion Cuckoo Clock
miracles.desc: Each time you enter the following domain, lose <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of all Cosmic Fragment(s) currently in your possession.
miracles.lore: After Screwllum, #76 member of the Genius Society, gained a hard-won peace for mechanical lifeforms, Planet Screwllum welcomed a Second Industrial Revolution. Countless inventors created curse machines, probability calculators, and candy guards, and passionately researched topics on the Seven Great Mysteries. As the topic ranking second amongst all, "Perpetual Motion" was loved by mechanical lifeforms. A great inventor, ranked nineteenth in Planet Screwllum, presented to the public their own Perpetual Motion Cuckoo Clock at the end of their life — This fine work used the Archimeles Spiral Energy to keep itself perpetually in motion, but the great inventor ended their own life for no apparent reason after receiving supreme honors for their creation.

miracles.name: Punklorde mentality
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, there is a <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> fixed chance to add to all enemies <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> Weakness(es) of the same Type(s) as allies currently on the field. These Weakness(es) last(s) for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).
miracles.lore: Life is just a game — This sentence is no mere jest for hackers from the cyberworld Punklorde. They traverse the internet and use a technology known as aether editing to alter reality, making life into a great game. Occasionally, the cream of the crop among them gets to soar away from the planet and use the vast galaxy as the second stage beyond the tutorial area. This cassette tape records the story of a legendary hacker. His life began in Punklorde's underground water reservoirs and ended in the company of the Galaxy Rangers. It is said that the funeral was a quiet one, with only a game cassette silently lying atop the coffin, serving as a footnote of "Finished the Game" at the hacker's final rites.

miracles.name: Beacon Coloring Paste
miracles.desc: When choosing a Blessing after winning a battle, randomly level up <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Blessing(s) among the selection.
miracles.lore: To better conduct intergalactic exploration and solve traffic blockage issues, Elias Salas, member #56 of the Genius Society, started research on the Synesthesia Beacon based on Aiden's existing studies. Elias Salas' analyses showed that <nobr>83%</nobr> of external sensory stimuli received by humans are visual in nature. Therefore, he prioritized in developing the Beacon Coloring Paste, trying to facilitate the connection between colors and language, music, taste, and scents. From then on, people could experience different meanings, scents, and sounds upon seeing a color. This is the poster child of a landmark achievement in interstellar synesthesia studies.

miracles.name: IPC Cuckoo Clock
miracles.desc: Cosmic Fragments required to level up and reset Blessings increase by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
miracles.lore: The IPC's initial Prototype Cuckoo Clock represents the beginning of Operation Cuckoo Clock. Many are curious why Operation Cuckoo Clock was conceived — Louis Fleming declared that the worship of Qlipoth, Aeon of Preservation, means the IPC needs to protect its hard-won presence. In his speech, he stated that while the Interastral Peace Corporation is now the master of the universe's finances, it still needs to remain vigilant against the catastrophe of the Finality. That is why he advocated the creation of the cuckoo clock series to collect information regarding that Aeon, meticulously removing any possibility of the IPC becoming bankrupt or disbanded in its future galactic journey.

miracles.name: Mechanical Cuckoo Clock
miracles.desc: Upon entering battle, consume <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Skill Point.
miracles.lore: After the Second Rubert Rebellion, the IPC had once planned a brutal extermination of all mechanical life across the Galaxy. Fortunately, before the plan was passed, the IPC heard that #76 Screwllum was selected by Nous to join the Genius Society. The IPC then made this mechanical cuckoo clock as a gift to appease the new genius. This gift is very unremarkable in today's view, but that was an era when mechanical beings were persecuted. The birth of the mechanical cuckoo clock itself is a symbol of peace.

blessings.name: Path Resonance: Preservation
blessings.shortDesc: After using the Path Resonance, deals Physical DMG to all enemies based on the max DMG that can be absorbed by Shields on all allies.

descPerLevel.1: Spend <nobr>100</nobr> points of Energy to use this ability and resonate with the Path of Preservation, dealing Physical DMG to all enemies based on the total Shield between all allies.

blessings.name: Divine Construct: Resonance Transfer
blessings.shortDesc: After attacking enemies, the attacking character deals <u>Quake</u> DMG based on the current Shield effect on the character.

descPerLevel.1: After a character launches an attack, deals Quake DMG equal to #1[i]% of the character's current Shield to the hit enemies.
descPerLevel.2: After a character launches an attack, deals Quake DMG equal to #1[i]% of the character's current Shield effect plus #2[i]% of the total Shield effect of the character's allies to the hit enemies.

extras.name: Quake
extras.desc: Additional DMG dealt by specific Blessings of Preservation.

blessings.name: Divine Construct: Metastatic Field
blessings.shortDesc: After a character is hit by an attack, deals <u>Quake</u> DMG based on the current Shield effect on the attacked character.

descPerLevel.1: After a character is hit, deals Quake DMG to the attacker, equal to #1[i]% of the character's current Shield effect. This DMG cannot defeat the enemy.
descPerLevel.2: After a character is attacked, deals Quake DMG to the attacker, equal to #1[i]% of the character's Shield effect just before the attack. This DMG cannot defeat the enemy.

extras.name: Quake
extras.desc: Additional DMG dealt by specific Blessings of Preservation.

blessings.name: Divine Construct: Macrosegregation
blessings.shortDesc: When entering battle, characters gain a stackable special Shield. This Shield is reset every #3[i] turn(s).

descPerLevel.1: At the start of the battle, characters gain a special Shield that can absorb DMG equal to #1[i]% of their Max HP. Whenever another Shield is gained, this special Shield will also strengthen in equal value. For every #3[i] turn(s), this will be removed, and then this special Shield can be regained.
descPerLevel.2: At the start of the battle, characters gain a special Shield that can absorb DMG equal to #1[i]% of their Max HP. Whenever another Shield is gained, this special Shield will also strengthen by #2[i]%. For every #3[i] turn(s), this will be removed, and then this special Shield can be regained.

blessings.name: Non-Inverse Antimatter Equation
blessings.shortDesc: If a character's current HP is below #6[i]%, they are considered to have extra stacks of Fighting Spirit.

descPerLevel.1: If a character's current HP is below #6[i]%, they are considered to have #5[i] extra stacks of Fighting Spirit.
descPerLevel.2: If a character's current HP is below #6[i]%, they are considered to have #5[i] extra stacks of Fighting Spirit. For every #8[i]% further HP lost, gains #9[i] extra stack(s) of Fighting Spirit.

extras.name: Fighting Spirit
extras.desc:
Buff brought by certain Destruction Blessings.
For each stack, increases ATK by #1[i]% and DEF by #2[i]%. Stacks up to #3[i] times.

blessings.name: Universal Heat Death Characteristic
blessings.shortDesc: When a character is hit or have their HP lowered, they gain #6[i] stack(s) of Fighting Spirit.

descPerLevel.1: When characters are hit or consume their own HP, they gain #6[i] stack(s) of Fighting Spirit. When the turn ends, the character loses #5[i] stack(s) of Fighting Spirit.
descPerLevel.2: When being hit or losing HP, the character gains #6[i] stacks of Fighting Spirit, and adjacent allies gain #7[i] stacks of Fighting Spirit. When the turn ends, the character loses #5[i] stacks of Fighting Spirit.

extras.name: Fighting Spirit
extras.desc:
Buff brought by certain Destruction Blessings.
For each stack, increases ATK by #1[i]% and DEF by #2[i]%. Stacks up to #3[i] times.

blessings.name: Prosperity, Longevity
blessings.shortDesc: When a character's HP is restored, <u>Dewdrop</u> is Charged according to the amount of healing received.

descPerLevel.1: Charges Dewdrop when a character's HP is restored. The Charge value is equal to #1[i]% of the amount of healing received.
